page.shortlink: api client api a5 select class

argument.name: selectId
argument.description: The ID of the SELECT element to bind to.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Data to use in the view box. If the view box uses static HTML, and does not require data, "null" can be passed in, or the data argument can be omitted.

argument.name: settings
argument.description: Settings for the select control. This will override the initial values of the properties of the A5.Select class.

discussion.p: The A5.Select class is a helper class that allows you to preform standard actions such as setting the value of a SELECT element, and populating the list of OPTIONs.

property.name: allowMissing
property.description: When preforming a A5.Select.setValue, if set to true, then values missing from the SELECT will be added. Otherwise missing values will not be kept by the A5.Select.setValue method.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the SELECT element.

property.name: disabledClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the SELECT element when the SELECT has been disabled.

property.name: style
property.description: The inline CSS to add to the SELECT element.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the SELECT element.

property.name: disabled
property.description: If true then the SELECT will be disabled.

property.name: onChange
property.description: Event fired when the value of the SELECT element changes.

property.name: onFocus
property.description: Event fired when the SELECT element receives focus.

property.name: onBlur
property.description: Event fired when the SELECT element looses focus.

property.name: onKeyDown
property.description: Event fired when a key down happens on the SELECT element.

property.name: onKeyUp
property.description: Event fired when a key up happens on the SELECT element.

property.name: onDblClick
property.description: Event fired when a double-click happens on the SELECT element.

property.name: onClick
property.description: Event fired when a click happens on the SELECT element.

property.name: onDown
property.description: Event fired when a mouse or touch down happens on the SELECT element.

property.name: onUp
property.description: Event fired when a mouse or touch up happens on the SELECT element.

page.note: To get a pointer to the A5.Select class in a UX see *[link: dialog.object.getControl Method Object]*.
